I am a retired city manager with 30 years experience in small and large cities. I currently work for SAS, a large privately held software company, for who I negotiate contracts with small and large local governments. I can give a comprehensive view of how to get the best for one's community from contract negotiations from  both perspectives. My professional goal at SAS is still the continued improvement of local government. Bill Coleman

author: Cory Fleming
text:
We need to identify two or three seasoned small community managers (population under 5,000) who would be willing to share their experiences in working with vendors to get the best results for the community.   Below is a full description of the session in question.
Good Negotiating & Management Skills:  Getting the Best Results from Vendors 
Monday, October 8, 12:45 – 2:00 pm
How do you negotiate the best deal for your community when you’re working with vendors who negotiate every day?   And once you’ve negotiated the contract, how do you manage the contract to insure the best results?  This session will highlight common contract errors and pitfalls to avoid as well as provide tips to ensure quality work for the community.  And we’ll discuss how to get out of a bad contract as a last resort.
Session Leader: Lon Pluckhahn, CM, City of Marion, IA
If you have any questions or want to volunteer to help with this session, please contact Cory Fleming at cfleming@icma.org or call 207-854-1083.
title: Looking for Small Community Managers to Speak at ICMA Annual Conference
